title: PHPfflush()Function

metadata.description: Learn about PHPfflush()Function with clear explanations and practical examples.

content_sections.title: Details
content_sections.content:
Example
Write all buffered output to the open file:
<?php
$file = fopen("test.txt","r+");
rewind($file);
fwrite($file, 'Hello World');
fflush($file);
fclose($file);
?>
Definition and Usage
The fflush() function writes all buffered output to an open file.
Syntax
fflush(
file
)
Parameter Values
Parameter
Description
file
Required. Specifies the open file to write the buffered output to
Technical Details
Return Value:
TRUE on success, FALSE on 
 failure
PHP Version:
4.0.1+

★
+1

practice_exercises.solution:
<?php
$file = fopen("test.txt","r+");
rewind($file);
fwrite($file, 'Hello World');
fflush($file);
fclose($file);
?>

summary: This tutorial covers PHPfflush()Function concepts and techniques. You'll learn how to use PHPfflush()Function effectively, including key principles, common patterns, and practical examples. By the end of this tutorial, you'll have a solid understanding of PHPfflush()Function and how to apply it in your projects.
